title: Add support for mio v0.8
body: Add support for mio-v0.8, not sure if this is the best way since it duplicates most of the v0.7, also not sure if there is a better way for this doing this, this allows helix which in terms depends on crossterm to be able to use signal-hook-mio with v0.8 to prevent crate duplication.

title: Async crates improvements
body:
* Make the streams for _all_ variants of SignalsInfo
* Remove unnecessary parts of examples

title: add haiku support
body:
hello,

this adds haiku support per #119. if there is a more idiomatic way to handle this, would be open to suggestions.

the following shows a run of the unit tests  (after successful compilation) in which currently only one test doesn't pass.  my guess is that this test for haiku can probably be suppressed as it is unclear if datagram over unix sockets in haiku is currently available.

thanks!

```
> uname -a
```

Look at: https://docs.rs/signal-hook/0.3.9/signal_hook/iterator/struct.SignalsInfo.html#method.wait

title: Remove extra space in doc
body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4687791/120675723-ea196180-c4c7-11eb-9878-4f4980a7502d.png)

title: Remove `SA_NOCLDSTOP` flag
body:
Hey!

I am using ptrace with tokio and I need to wait for the SIGCHLD every time the process stops. But `SA_NOCLDSTOP` disables this feature. I don't know why it is set. You can find my investigation here https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/issues/3804 😄

title: Fix example code
body: The trailing closing delimiter is unexpected

title: Remove duplicate cfg_attr
body:
This removes the duplicate `cfg_attr` that is leading to docs.rs build failures.

I ran the docs.rs build locally and it finished successfully - though strangely it's failing for 0.3.6 whereas their build finished successfully (even though both `cfg_attr`s are already there)

title: Unmask the signal when emulating
body:
When emulating a termination signal, unmask it in case it is masked, so
it may work.

title: signal-hook-async-std: Switch to using async-io + futures-lite
body:
Switch to async-std's underlying async-io and futures-lite crates for
better compatibility with smol and using fewer dependencies in general.
Doing this also does not substantially changing the code, which is a
plus.

title: Remove the implement_signals_with_pipe macro
body:
It was previously being used to share logic that was common across multiple tokio versions. It's unnecessary now that
only one version is supported.

title: Update signal-hook-tokio for tokio v1.0
body:
This drops support for pre-1.0 versions of tokio, and removes the per-version features and modules.

Fixes #83.

title: iterator feature requires channel feature
body:
In signal-hook 0.3.3, iterator feature requires channel feature, but currently, it is not specified and we will get the following compilation error:

```console
$ cargo check --no-default-features --features iterator
   Compiling signal-hook v0.3.3 ...

error[E0432]: unresolved import `crate::low_level::channel`
  --> src/iterator/exfiltrator/raw.rs:17:23
   |
17 | use crate::low_level::channel::Channel;
   |                       ^^^^^^^ could not find `channel` in `low_level`

error[E0283]: type annotations needed
  --> src/iterator/exfiltrator/raw.rs:21:17
   |
21 | pub struct Slot(AtomicPtr<Channel<siginfo_t>>);
   |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot infer type
   |
   = note: cannot satisfy `_: Default`
   = note: required by `std::default::Default::default`
   = note: this error originates in a derive macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
```

I confirmed the issue fixed by this patch and confirmed there were no other similar issues by using [cargo-hack](https://github.com/taiki-e/cargo-hack#--feature-powerset):

```sh
cargo hack check --feature-powerset --no-dev-deps --all
```

title: Raw siginfo origin
body:
Exposing some more modular stuff:

* An exfiltrator to get hands directly on the siginfo_t
* A way to convert siginfo_t to origin outside of the iterator

title: Use caret requirements on -registry
body: Part of #76

title: Extractor for the signal cause and origin
Remove futures dependency from async-std adapter
body:
The `async-std` crate does not actually depend on the `futures` crate
for the types `Context`, `Poll`, `AsyncRead` (simply called `Read` in
`async-std`), `Stream`, and `StreamExt`. It instead relies on the
versions of `Context` and `Poll` from the Rust standard library, which
it re-exports, and provides its own definition of the `Read`, `Stream`,
and `StreamExt` traits. For this reason users of the
`signal-hook-async-std` crate are unlikely to depend on the `futures`
crate themselves, making this crate's dependency on `futures`
unnecessary.

This commit replaces these types with the versions from `async-std` and
removes the `futures` dependency from the `signal-hook-async-std` crate.

In another project I am working on that uses `signal-hook` and
`async-std`, this change removed the following 10 crates from my
dependency list:

- futures
- futures-executor
- futures-macro
- futures-sink
- futures-task
- futures-util
- pin-project
- pin-project-internal
- proc-macro-hack
- proc-macro-nested

title: Do not consume the Signals instance in the forever method
body:
This code should fix #70

This is a breaking change for the signal-hook crate but it isn't a breaking change for the adapter crates.

title: Include checks for bunch of other platforms
body:
Only cargo check, but checks stuff at least compiles on many weird
things.

title: Fix some doc links
body:
By leaving the resolution up to rustdoc, now that it can do it. No
longer necessary to provide the actual target.

Closes #64.

title: Add additional signal reexports
body:
This adds the following signals to the `libc` reexports:

| Signal    | Description                            |
| --------- | -------------------------------------- |
| SIGTSTP   | Stop typed at terminal                 |
| SIGPWR    | Power failure (System V)               |
| SIGTTIN   | Terminal input for background process  |
| SIGTTOU   | Terminal output for background process |
| SIGURG    | Urgent condition on socket (4.2BSD)    |
| SIGVTALRM | Virtual alarm clock (4.2BSD)           |
| SIGXCPU   | CPU time limit exceeded (4.2BSD)       |
| SIGXFSZ   | File size limit exceeded (4.2BSD)      |

These are all the signals that are defined in `libc` which are not
aliases to other existing signals. The main useful one here is `SIGTSTP`
for handling ^Z, but adding all missing signals seems sensible.

The only other signal documented which I have not added is `SIGEMT`
(Emulator trap), since it is not exported by `libc`.

title: Coverage in PR
body:
Run coverage in PR, as it makes sense in each commit + it'll end up in
the comments.

title: Prepare for 0.2.0 release
body: A bit of docs improvements, changelog, etc

title: actions: Don't run the tests twice on PR
body:
It's enough they are run on push. Only some other workflows are pr-only
and need that.

title: Don't leak a thread in tests
body:
Don't leave a thread waiting for signals behind. First, it's a bad form.
Second, it actually did receive the signal during some more tests and
the thread panics in the background, making noise on the console. And
the panic was not propagated anywhere.

So tell it to terminate, wait for it and make sure any legitimate panics
are propagated to the main thread.

title: Use .try_for_each instead of map().collect()
body: As suggested by the compiler.

title: Tokio 0.3 and async-std 1.0 support
body:
Eventually I'm able to implement the async-std support and also Tokio 0.3 support.

Kind of funny that this was the goal which started my signal-hook journey back in june :)

I added some macros to make common code for Tokio and async-std reusable. At the moment those live in their own small utility crate. Maybe there is a better place for them?
